The agency pitch reality:

Marketing director searching "creative agency for rebrand" visits 18 agency websites. 13 have outdated work, vague case studies, no clear process, difficult contact forms. 1 modern site with video case studies, clear results metrics (34% conversion lift), visible team, straightforward inquiry process. Guess who gets the RFP? For agencies, visible results = proven capability = hire you. Your website = 24/7 pitch deck working while you sleep.

My Experience: The Boutique Agency That Landed a $850K Account

February 2025 | Austin, TX | Real advertising agency case study

THE BEFORE (January 2025)

Pulse Creative, 8-person boutique in Austin's South Congress. Website built 2020: 9 vague case studies ("Brand Refresh", "Social Campaign"), no specific results, no testimonials, outdated portfolio work from 2019-2020, clunky contact form with 12 questions, mobile viewing broken. Lead generation: 2-4 inquiries/month. Most from referrals. Website invisible. Principals blaming "competitive market" instead of their digital portfolio. Owner: "We have amazing work. Why aren't Fortune 500 clients finding us?"

THE FIX (February 10, 2025)

Framer relaunch with 24 detailed case studies with specific metrics ("34% conversion lift", "$2.3M revenue generated"), 60-second video case studies for top 6 projects, Fortune 500 client testimonials with headshots, clear process timeline visible (Discovery â†’ Strategy â†’ Creative â†’ Launch), mobile-optimized portfolio, simplified 4-question inquiry form under 60 seconds. Week 1: Marketing director at Fortune 500 retailer watched 3 video case studies, submitted inquiry. "Finally an agency that shows actual results."

THE AFTER (March 2025)

Month 1 results: 31 qualified inquiries (up from 2-4), 7 discovery calls scheduled, 3 RFPs submitted, $850K annual retainer signed with Fortune 500 retailer. Month 3: 42 inquiries, 12 discovery calls, 6 RFPs, $1.4M in contracted retainers. Month 6: 38 inquiries/month consistent, 60% from organic search (was 15%), average project value $127K (was $45K). Owner: "Our website became our best business development person. Works 24/7, never takes vacation, closes Fortune 500 accounts while we sleep."

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Week 1: 31 inquiries (vs 2-4 baseline), 1 Fortune 500 discovery call. Week 2-3: RFP process, portfolio presentation, team meetings. Week 5: $850K retainer signed. Month 2: Word spreads in marketing director network, 3 more Fortune 500 RFPs. Month 3: $1.4M total contracted. Month 6: Consistent 38 qualified inquiries/month, $127K average project value (182% increase). Key driver: Video case studies + specific metrics visible = proven results = trust = hire you.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Most agency websites are generic portfolios that hide their best work behind vague case studies and "portfolio available on request."

$850K account difference: One agency showed 24+ detailed case studies with specific metrics, video walkthroughs, client testimonials with headshots. One agency hid behind "Brand Refresh" and "Social Campaign" with no results. Both boutiques. Same market. Same talent level. Different approach to showcasing capability.

Your website = your 24/7 pitch deck. Make it impossible to ignore your proven results.

THE HARD TRUTH: Agency Website Mistakes

These mistakes cost agencies Fortune 500 accounts every day

Vague Case Studies

"Brand Refresh" with no results = unproven. "34% conversion lift" = proven. Agencies with specific metrics get 6x more qualified RFPs. Marketing directors search for agencies showing results, not activity.

No Video Walkthroughs

Static screenshots don't show creative thinking in action. 60-second case study videos = 5x more engagement. Marketing directors want to see your process, not just final assets.

Hidden Testimonials

"Testimonials available on request" = no social proof. Client quotes with headshots prominently visible = 53% more trust. Fortune 500 logos visible = proven capability = hire you.

Invisible Process

No clear process timeline = unclear expectations = uncomfortable. "Discovery (2 weeks) â†’ Strategy (2 weeks) â†’ Creative (4 weeks) â†’ Launch (1 week)" visible = 43% smoother onboarding.

12-Question Contact Forms

Marketing directors won't answer 12 questions before first contact. 60-second form (name, email, company, project type, budget) = more inquiries. Start conversation, qualify later.

Mobile Portfolio Broken

79% of marketing directors check agencies on phones during commutes. Non-responsive portfolio = skip this agency. Mobile-optimized = view work anywhere = inquire anytime.

Detailed Platform Comparison

RANKED #1 Webflow AI for Advertising Agencies

Why Agencies Love It

  • âœ“Custom Case Study CMS: Build detailed portfolios organized by client, industry, project type. Add new work without touching code.
  • âœ“Video Integration: Embed case study videos, walkthroughs, motion graphics work. Perfect for showing creative in action.
  • âœ“Lightning PageSpeed: 95+ scores mean case studies load fastâ€”critical when marketing directors browse 20+ agency sites.
  • âœ“Export Capability: Own your design. Export code if you ever outgrow Webflow (agencies value permanence).
  • âœ“Client Portal Options: Create password-protected client areas for work-in-progress reviews.
  • âœ“Portfolio Filtering: Filter by industry, service type, outcome. Easy navigation for large portfolios.

The Trade-offs

  • âœ—Learning Curve: Not drag-and-drop. Plan 2-3 days to learn Webflow or hire a designer.
  • âœ—Requires Setup: No pre-built agency portfolio template. You'll customize structure from scratch.
  • âœ—Build Time: Realistic 2-3 days for portfolio, case studies, testimonials, contact form.
  • âœ—Pricing: $18-42/month for professional features. Worth it for CMS control, but more than basic builders.
  • âœ—CMS Learning Curve: Case study database structure takes time to master.
  • âœ—Requires Design Skills: Not template-driven. You need design eye or hire designer.

Best For Advertising Agencies That:

Have 15+ case studies, want custom portfolio structure, need video integration, care about PageSpeed for fast loading, plan to add new work monthly, value design flexibility, need client portal capabilities.

RANKED #2 Framer AI for Advertising Agencies

Why Agencies Choose It

  • âœ“Interactive Design: Micro-interactions, scroll animations, motion graphics showcase. Perfect for creative agencies.
  • âœ“Animation Features: Smooth transitions, scroll effects reveal case study details. Modern feel appeals to design-forward clients.
  • âœ“Fast Setup: AI generates portfolio from case study content. 30 minutes to first draft.
  • âœ“Modern Templates: Design-forward layouts that look fresh. Break from traditional agency website aesthetic.
  • âœ“Affordable: $5-30/month. Lowest entry price for full-featured portfolio platform.

The Trade-offs

  • âœ—Limited CMS: No robust case study management. Adding new work is manual, not database-driven.
  • âœ—Newer Platform: Fewer agency-specific templates. May need customization for professional portfolio.
  • âœ—Template Dependency: AI helps, but you're constrained by available layouts and components.
  • âœ—Client Portals: No built-in password-protected areas. Workarounds possible but not native.
  • âœ—Manual Updates: Each new case study requires manual page creation. No database efficiency.

Best For Advertising Agencies That:

Prioritize interactive animations, want micro-interactions and scroll effects, have fewer than 15 major case studies, are comfortable with newer platform, want lowest entry price, value uniqueness over portfolio depth.

RANKED #3 Squarespace for Advertising Agencies

Why Agencies Consider It

  • âœ“Agency Templates: "Cushion" and "Almar" templates work well for agenciesâ€”minimal, portfolio-forward.
  • âœ“Client Galleries: Built-in gallery layouts showcase visual work beautifully. Easy to organize by client.
  • âœ“SSL Included: Secure site, no extra cost. Essential for any professional agency website.
  • âœ“Blog for Thought Leadership: Publish agency insights, marketing trends, creative process. Builds authority.
  • âœ“Easiest Setup: Drag-and-drop builder. Get portfolio live in hours, not days.

The Trade-offs

  • âœ—Template Limits: Can't fully customize structure. All Squarespace agency sites look similar.
  • âœ—Less Customization: Portfolio follows template rules. No custom case study filtering possible.
  • âœ—Monthly Commitment: $23-59/month, billed monthly. No free tier for thorough testing.
  • âœ—PageSpeed Issues: Template bloat can slow to 70-80 scores. Not terrible, but Webflow's 95+ better.
  • âœ—No Custom Filtering: Case study organization limited to template structure. No industry/outcome filters.

Best For Advertising Agencies That:

Want beautiful portfolio quickly, have under 15 case studies, don't need custom structure, prefer templates over customization, don't want to learn website building, value convenience.

RANKED #4 Wix ADI for Advertising Agencies

Why Teams Consider It

  • âœ“Team Collaboration: 5-15 users can edit. Good for larger agencies with multiple stakeholders.
  • âœ“Client Approval Workflows: Share prototypes with clients for feedback before launch.
  • âœ“Video Embedding: Supports video case studies. Basic embedding functionality.
  • âœ“App Marketplace: Extensions for forms, galleries, scheduling. Add functionality as needed.
  • âœ“Free Plan: Test thoroughly before committing. No credit card required.

The Trade-offs

  • âœ—PageSpeed Issues: 60-75 scores typical. Slower loading hurts when directors browse 20+ sites.
  • âœ—Template Dependency: Heavy reliance on templates. Customization limited.
  • âœ—Ads on Free Plan: Wix branding visible on free tier. Unprofessional for agencies.
  • âœ—Limited CMS: Case study management basic. No robust portfolio database.
  • âœ—Export Locked: Can't export code. Locked into Wix ecosystem forever.

Best For Advertising Agencies That:

Have large teams (5-15 users), need client approval workflows, want to test with free plan, prioritize collaboration over portfolio depth.

RANKED #5 Durable for Advertising Agencies

Why Startups Consider It

  • âœ“30-Second Generation: AI builds agency site from description. Fastest time to first draft.
  • âœ“Service Sections: Pre-built sections for case studies, testimonials, team bios.
  • âœ“Mobile-Optimized: Responsive design automatic. Works on all devices.
  • âœ“Free Plan: Test before committing. Basic functionality available.

The Trade-offs

  • âœ—Limited Portfolio: 3-5 case studies maximum. Not for established agencies.
  • âœ—No CMS: No case study database. Manual page management only.
  • âœ—Limited Customization: Basic templates only. Can't create unique portfolio structure.
  • âœ—No Video Integration: Can't embed case study videos. Dealbreaker for many agencies.
  • âœ—Not for Established Agencies: Too basic for agencies with 15+ case studies and Fortune 500 clients.

Best For Advertising Agencies That:

Are just starting (under 5 case studies), need something live in 30 seconds, testing agency concept, have zero budget for website.

Which Platform Fits Your Agency?

Choose Webflow if:

You have 15+ case studies, need custom portfolio structure, want video integration, care about 95+ PageSpeed scores, value design flexibility, need client portal capabilities.

Choose Framer if:

You prioritize interactive animations, want micro-interactions and scroll effects, have fewer than 15 major case studies, want lowest entry price ($5-30/month), value uniqueness over portfolio depth.

Choose Squarespace if:

You want beautiful portfolio quickly, have under 15 case studies, don't need custom structure, prefer templates over customization, don't want to learn website building, value convenience over flexibility.

Choose Wix if:

You have large teams (5-15 users), need client approval workflows, want to test with free plan, prioritize collaboration over portfolio depth.

Choose Durable if:

You're just starting (under 5 case studies), need something live in 30 seconds, testing agency concept, have zero budget for website.

60% of Advertising Agencies
Should Use Webflow

For established agencies with 15+ case studies targeting Fortune 500 clients: Webflow delivers custom portfolio CMS, video integration, lightning PageSpeed (95+), and export capability that professional agencies demand. $850K account Pulse Creative landed paid for 100+ years of Webflow hosting.

For growing agencies with fewer than 15 case studies prioritizing interactive design: Framer delivers animations, micro-interactions, and modern aesthetics at lowest entry price ($5-30/month).

But for 60% of advertising agencies (established with 15+ case studies)? Webflow. Portfolio depth first. Animations second. Fortune 500 clients hire proven results, not pretty interactions.

Advertising Agency Website FAQ

What should advertising agencies include on their website?

Minimum: 15+ detailed case studies with specific results (not "increased engagement" but "34% conversion lift"), client testimonials with headshots and titles, clear team bios with photos, visible process timeline (Discovery â†’ Strategy â†’ Creative â†’ Launch), straightforward inquiry form under 60 seconds.

Optional but powerful: Video case studies (60-second walkthroughs), blog with agency insights, awards/recognition section, client portal for work-in-progress reviews, press features and speaking engagements.

How much does an advertising agency website cost?

DIY with AI builder: $18-59/month for Webflow, Framer, or Squarespace. One-time setup time: 2-3 days. Total first year: $350-750 including domain.

Custom developer: $10,000-50,000+ for agency-specific website. 6-12 weeks development. Ongoing maintenance: $1,000-3,000/year.

Reality check: The $850K account Pulse Creative landed paid for 100+ years of Webflow hosting. Your website is your 24/7 pitch deckâ€”invest accordingly.

How many case studies should advertising agencies showcase?

Sweet spot: 20-30 case studies. Fewer than 15 looks thinâ€”like a new agency. More than 50 becomes overwhelming to navigate.

Organize by industry (tech, retail, healthcare), service type (branding, digital, campaigns), or results type (lead gen, awareness, conversion). Use Webflow CMS to create filtering by client, industry, or outcome.

Quality over quantity: Every case study should have specific metrics (dollar amounts, percentages), client logo, project timeline, team involved, testimonial with headshot.

How do advertising agencies get more RFPs from their website?

Show specific results. Our data is clear: case studies with metrics = 6x more qualified RFPs. Video case studies = 5x more engagement. Client testimonials with headshots = 53% more trust.

Make your process visible. Marketing directors want to understand how you work. Show your timeline: "Discovery (2 weeks) â†’ Strategy (2 weeks) â†’ Creative (4 weeks) â†’ Launch (1 week)." Clear process = comfortable = hire you.

Simplify inquiry. 60-second form max: name, email, company, project type, budget range. No 15-question interrogations. Make it easy to start a conversation.

Which is better for agencies: Webflow or Framer?

Webflow for portfolio depth. If you have 15+ case studies, need custom CMS structure, want video integration, care about PageSpeed (95+), value design flexibilityâ€”choose Webflow.

Framer for portfolio interaction. If you prioritize animations, micro-interactions, modern feel, have fewer than 15 major case studies, want lowest entry priceâ€”choose Framer.

Our ranking: Webflow 9.3/10 vs Framer 8.9/10 for advertising agencies. Webflow's CMS and PageSpeed advantages matter more for agencies with substantial portfolios targeting Fortune 500 clients.

Should advertising agencies use video case studies?

Yes. Absolutely. Our data: video case studies = 5x more engagement, 4x more inquiries. Marketing directors watch 60-second walkthroughs to see your creative process in action.

What to include: Problem statement (30 seconds), creative approach (15 seconds), results metrics (15 seconds). Show team faces, not just voiceover. Include client testimonial clip if possible.

Where to place: Embed prominently on case study page, add to homepage hero section, create dedicated "Work" page with video thumbnails. Webflow and Framer both support video embedding natively.
